meanings.sent1: She managed to outskate all her friends at the ice rink.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outskate his competitors during the race.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to outskate the seal, but it was a comical sight.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outskate her fears propelled her forward.
meanings.sent5: The champion skater's ability to outskate everyone was truly impressive.

meanings.definition: To skate faster or better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the competition, he was able to outskate his opponents effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: She practiced hard to outskate her previous record in the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit challenged the turtle to a race, confident it could outskate its slow competitor.
meanings.sent4: His passion for skating allowed him to outskate any obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to whisper secrets to those who could outskate its swift movements.
